Reviews.Title: “Couldn't stay because of a flood”
Reviews.Author: SirNigelC
Reviews.Content: I had a room booked here for a business trip but never got past reception. They had suffered a flood and couldn't accommodate me. They organised a room at the (fairly) nearby Tavistock Hotel so all was well, but I wonder why they couldn't have let me know in advance as a lot of time was wasted and I was almost late for "The Ladykillers" since the Tavistock is a lot further from the west end. These things happen though, and they did their best. I'd like to try to stay again as the location is very good - just round the corner from Tottenham Court Rd station and the reception looked nice. They did offer me a coffee as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: M2bfx
Reviews.Content: First time here and we arrived at 3am with a very helpful receptionist, our room was G5 as shown on someone's else's review. Very clean and the beds were good and clean, very tall ceilings and nice decor.....cold breeze coming from window but it is -5 outside. Booked again for march.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, not a very good review but you do get what you pay for. My partner and I went on a Saturday as we were seeing a show. Well we ordered a suite but was told that it was not available as they were doing maintenance on it, so we settled for a double (no option really) which was small and not very cosy. The bathroom blind fell down, the bath panel had a massive hole in it, the glasses in the room still had lipstick on them and the blind in the bedroom did not open. The breakfast area was no better. It was so cold in the basement and the staff said the heating was broken so as soon as you got your cooked breakfast you had to eat it in double quick time as it was freezing cold leaving your food congealed on your plate. We were not offered extra toast as most hotels do or coffee. We even had to pay to leave our bag in the hotel whilst we wandered round London on the day we left. Disgusting. Would not recommend unless you really were desperate.

Reviews.Title: “check your bill”
Reviews.Author: Laura N
Reviews.Content: told when we arrived that booking was cancelled, although i checked that booking was ok day before they eventually did find as a room that was ok ,no real complaints about the room as we didnt spend much time in it. the location is very good problem when we tried to check out they tried to charge us Â£18+ for phone calls from our room which we did not make when I complained they said theywould investigate now i find they have charged my credit card this hotel is run by incompetant staff

Reviews.Title: “The YMCA Would be Better!”
Reviews.Author: MCTME
Reviews.Content: OMG!!! One of my pet hates are cheap, nasty hotels where staff work and hardly speak a word of english and the main aim is to rip you off!!! And the Cheshire Hotel is a PERFECT example of this. Â£120 per night. Are you kidding me. The hotel is filthy, discusting, falling to peices, the dingiest and the smallest room I've stayed in. Breakfast was swimming in grease. Please I beg you give this one a swerve and stay at the Y, The council should be ashamed of allowing this place to remain open. Final Tip: Avoid at ALL cost!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously odd!”
Reviews.Author: 675Helicreature675
Reviews.Content: We arrived to be met by a Receptionist who announced in extremely broken English that there was a problem with our room (booked several days before) but that it was 'okay' because they had found us a room in another hotel. The inference was that we should be grateful. It was pouring with rain and we were due at a party in Covent Garden in half an hour so my husband asked if this 'other hotel' was nearby.It took several attempts at re-wording the question before the receptionist decided to summon someone who spoke English. The reinforcement heard our plea to be settled somewhere quickly as we were already cutting it fine and to his credit agreed that we could stay there (phew!) adding sotto voce that they would have to send someone else to the mysterious 'other hotel'. He then asked for our card and went to charge us before we had seen the room. Okay - so it's inexpensive for London (Â£152 with breakfast) but seriously? pre charging, when they already had our card number and we were obviously a middle aged professional couple - with luggage! :) The room (404) was a cupboard, with the most basic bedding I have ever seen - one thin pillow, threadbare blankets - but it was clean so we dumped our luggage and paid up before departing for the party. Had we not been under such time constraint we would have politely declined and moved on. On our return to the room later, it became apparent that there was not only no tea making facilities but not even a bottle of water. We ended up ordering tea from 'room service' ('Room Service 'in name only- basically only over-priced drinks and Pringles served by some poor beleagured night porter) and we huddled together for warmth under the thin blankets and slept so fitfully that we both saw dawn rise. Breakfast was similarly Fawlty Towers and when on leaving we explained that we had had room service and would like to pay there was yet more confusion and more questions - what had we had? we'd have to wait while the bill for it was found, and eventually..... how WOULD we like to pay the Â£1.70? In retrospect it is quite funny but at the time it was cold, depressing and frustrating and I would urge you to avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cozy & Basic”
Reviews.Author: Mikey954HighWycombe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of October/beginning of November, it is perfect for the tube and Covent Garden, Leicester Square, China Town etc. The rooms are small, the bathroom was basic and really needed painting/replacing. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very nice and well cooked, although there was no bar or evening meals. This didnt bother us at all because we always eat out and there are loads of fabulous restaurants all around you. We had the windows open at night and there was an awful lot of noise all through the night, but I suppose you have to expect that. I gave this a very good rating because of the location and staff rather than the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MarySandyford
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - easily accessible from Heathrow by tube. Just one changeover needed on tube lines. Reception Staff very friendly and couldnt do enough for us. Any request was adhered to quickly and with a smile. Breakfast was adequate - cooked English breakfast was available and freshly cooked when ordered. Very near to British Museum and most of the theatres. Oxford Street just a few minutes walk away. Safe and quiet location and Sainsburys nearby for presents to bring home!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: emmasmiles
Reviews.Content: Would like to say the staff were very helpful and welcoming.Hotel was in a great location for our theatre break,not far to walk to Trafalgar square etc,,tube and bus access very close. Very simple rooms but that's all we wanted,clean and tidy with tea and coffee making tray(even biscuits) Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, wont be back..”
Reviews.Author: Robert K
Reviews.Content: The cheshire builds up a good picture on the net,, but in reality it does not appear the same when you get there , i and my partner were put in 302. the room was small and dark .not much space to move about ..the carpet was threadbare and had holes . the matress was stained , the wardrobe door would not close properly, the bed headboard was stuck to the wall with silicone ..the view was a brick wall and a dingy ally.. to the bathroom ,cracked and broken tiles reparied again with silicone, stained toilet basin the ceiling was stained and covered in damp patches . the bath panel was broken and had 2 large holes with splintered and jaged edges... The only good thing i can say ,the staff were very friendy and helpful the breakfast was ok but the fact that only 1 girl had to do everything and i mean everything from cleaning cooking and serving was not really acceptable all in all not a good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Old, noisy and not much fun”
Reviews.Author: HXY1968
Reviews.Content: Wasnt sure about even going to this hotel, especially after paying for our room in advance they still chose to pre- authorise our card to the tune of the price of the room again. Not happy that they retained our card details online and the 'computer' decided to take a payment all by itself. Spoke to a man who said he was the manager to sort it out, turns out he wasn't and had to ring again to get it sorted. Knew we'd made a mistake when we pulled up outside. Although ideally situated off Tottenham Court Rd, it looks tired and 'cheap'. Because of the trouble we'd had before getting there they promised us their best room, if the room we had was their best I wouldn't hold out much hope for their worst. The room was small, and I've been to Paris so I know small when I see it. No duvet, there was a bed cover and pulling that back there was a scratchy army style blanket underneath. We slept on top. The bathroom was dark and grotty, there was a cigarette burn in the bath and the door lock looked like it had been chopped out, stuffed with paper and then glued back in. Not nice. For one night it was bearable, but given more notice we wouldn't have slept there. Staff seemed ok and breakfast was average but the most annoying thing there was a noise all night, we couldnt work out if it was inside the room or outside on the street but it sounded like air conditioning and was very loud and very annoying and kept us awake. All in all we were not happy and wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “never ever stay in this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: don m
Reviews.Content: When we arrived for our 4 day break in the city we were handed the keys to room 302....then a nightmare started....the carpet was threadbare and dirty...the toilet hadnt been cleaned the pillows smelled...in general it was awful! After complaining...to the hotel and booking.com with whom we booked, we were told we could cancel...then told a different story at reception..it appears staff are not up on their policies...or any hotel matters for that matter! We were allocated a different room on the 5th floor..whcih was a bit cleaner but still terrible for th Â£476-00 we paid for our stay. The floor we were put on was undergoing redecoration and every morning was a early wake up call......not that we slept much with the paint fumes...also were told off like naughty children on the last night for not leaving our key into reception when going out of the hotel...well how could we leave in our key when no one told us to do so...please do not stay in this hotel....unless you want to ruin your trip to a fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and decent hotel - but don't expect too much!”
Reviews.Author: Selva18
Reviews.Content: Cheshire hotel is very close to Tottenham Court Road Station. It is quite clean and nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I stayed on the 7th floor for one day. It was a clean room, but very small. This is a good hotel to stay as value for money and for location, would not recommend for long stays.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy, noisy, horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: paleyellow
Reviews.Content: When I checked out of this hotel I was almost in tears because I was so tired. I stayed for one night, mid week in room G5, and it cost Â£205. The room is bang opposite the lift, almost in the lobby and when I asked to move I was told it wasn't possible. The hotel is in a great location - just a minute's walk from Tottenham Court Road tube station. And from the outside it looks quite nice. But inside, it's horrible. The room I was in was grubby, with almost everything cracked, broken, scratched, fag burned and generally in need of a thorough scrub. There is no sound insulation so you hear every conversation throughout the night as people wait for the lift. It's a tiny, narrow corridor so people bang into your door - and the lift itself CLANG, CLANG, CLANGS. The doors from the lobby to the lift bang too. And then there's the street noise and the noise from neighbouring rooms' showers, TVs and conversations. You can hear everything. When I told the lady on reception how bad it had been she said, "Yes, we know, people have said that before." This room shouldn't be a guest room - they should use it as an office. They certainly shouldn't be charging over Â£200 a night for it. Shocking.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: J04NN4
Reviews.Content: We bought tickets to a gig last minute and needed a hotel room 3 days before Christmas. We had pretty slim pickings so didn't have very high expectations of this place and were pleasantly surprised. It's clean, comfy, has a fantastic location and is very quiet for where it is. If I was being picky I'd say the room was a little cold but it was during the big freeze in Dec '10 and it snowed the whole time we were there so I suppose that's fair enough! There's no bar or restaurant and it's definitely not a luxury hotel but as a base for exploring the city it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: HDBermuda
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly adequate. The location was ideal--a 2 minute walk to the British Museum. It wouldn't have been my first choice but as London was unusually busy due to the royal wedding, I was probably lucky to find anything! The hotel is clean but in need of updating. Rooms are very small but comfortable enough. Business travelers should not be charged for Wifi as it was not connectable from the room or the restaurant and calls were often dropped from other areas. The restaurant is worth skipping. However, the proprietors were very friendly and tried their best to be accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but room very SHABBY and OVERPRICED.”
Reviews.Author: lauraslittleangels
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is really good.The room decor was very dated,desperately needing a revamp. Carpet in the room was thread bare with lots of holes and the chest of drawers only had 2 drawers in use as the other one didnt open.There wasnt any room to move around in the room as everything seems to be crammed in.The internet was down for three out of the four nights and the staff just kept saying they were waiting on an engineer to come out in an hour.The breakfast was ok.You basically pay for the location.I think its overpriced . I think if it was refurbed it would make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “review of room 207”
Reviews.Author: ducky098
Reviews.Content: The room was small but perfectly formed, except the furniture (except the bed) was to big for the room. This made getting out of bed a problem, especially in the night. The bathroom was good, again,except the shower which had a tendancy leak all over.

Reviews.Title: “The location's good, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: eiko-chan
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in Cheshire Hotel. It was easy to find, location is very ideal (near the tube and bus stop) and the lady at the reception during the day was very very friendly and helpful. I booked a single room. While the room is quite small, the bed and bathroom is pretty big. If i don't have a huge luggage with me the room would be just nice. The hotel (and room) is pretty old, but the bathroom is clean so it's good enough for me. What i really don't like though, is that they lock the front door (main entrance) at night! The reception claims to be open 24-hours, but on my first night, i got back at 3am. The door was locked, it was cold outside (-4c that night) and the streets pretty quiet. If my friends weren't with me it would be pretty scary because i thought i was locked out. I knocked on the door and even called, but there was no response for about 15 minutes till the night receptionist came out to open the door for me. My friends came in with me because they wanted to see my room. The receptionist called out to me (while we were walking to the elevator... and he was quite rude, if i may add) that my room is a single room, and that guests aren't allowed at this hour. While i understand that this may be hotel policy etc, but i do not appreciate being treated as if i am staying in a hostel with curfew! It would be a completely different situation if he wasn't that rude (and it would've been better if i wasn't out in the cold for 15 minutes). In conclusion, i would recommend this hotel for the location, and only if you are staying with a couple of friends because the streets are pretty quiet at night, and as there is the possibility that you might be "locked-out" at times, it's better to be safe than sorry.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant West End find”
Reviews.Author: BristolWoman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect secret. Fantastic location and a wonderful staff team with a willingness to do everything possible to help make our stay comfortable. Yes, the decor is a little tired but it's all very clean and for the price we paid, we definitely got the best deal in this part of central London. I particularly recommend Nishi at reception â€“ she couldn't do enough to make us feel welcome. This hotel is a gem and we have been back time and time again and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: SFayers
Reviews.Content: There is a wide mixture of reviews on this hotel. I would say that the location is pretty much perfect for central london. It sits in a nice quiet street and the building looks very nice from outside. We arrived very late for our booking but the hotel clerk was very helpful and friendly. We had a room on the top floor which was small but cosy. I have stayed in far smaller rooms than this. The hotel is just a bit tired but this creates a nice old school atmosphere. The price for this type of hotel in this area is average. Overall i was very satisfied with this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not good either...”
Reviews.Author: wellrespectedman
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed in many a London hotel over the years and normally stay at Travelogues, but that was booked up the night i wanted to stay, so i thought bit cheaper Â£20 quid, i will give The Cheshire a go, well what can i say, room smaller than my bathroom at home!. Room was very small, even for London but sheets on the bed rather than a duvet and rather cold. I went to run the cold tap and hot water came out and hot water from the hot tap, so had to clean my teeth with warm water...not nice. Shower in the morning, after about 3 mins in the shower..no hot water, so please have a look at you're plumbing.Great location a 4 minute walk to where i wanted to be, but over all it was clean,but needs bringing up to date. So as i said not bad, but not good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tickle4
Reviews.Content: The main thing is that this hotel is in a great location - the same street as the British Museum and a few minutes walk from Covent Garden with loads of pubs and eateries on the way. Secondly the staff are great - extremely helpful and very friendly. The only downside is the hotel is a bit old and tired - missing tiles, torn carpets - dubious bedsprings and rooms a bit cramped - but it is spotlessly clean - great shower - plenty of clean fresh towels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and that's it”
Reviews.Author: someone5
Reviews.Content: The Location was splendid, but everything else regarding the hotel was poor. The rooms are tiny and dark with a bad smell of mildew. The bathroom wasn't clean enough and there was no attention to details. All in all - nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel in london”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Dahlia82
Reviews.Content: i have been to London on several occasions, and I always like to try new hotels. I really enjoyed this one, for the price it has a very nicely decorated room and a lovely bathroom, which sometimes it is not easy to find on small budget hotels in this city.. The location is really good, just about a block and a half from the tube, and the staff was helpful and attentive. The only downside to it was that i paid for the wifi, but then out of four nights, it only worked for two.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect place for a weekend in London!”
Reviews.Author: doubleuponthejuice
Reviews.Content: People tend to write negative things about this hotel. I have only positive things to say. We were met by a very professionel and nice receptionist from india, who gave us our room 306. A perfect corner room with many windows and great light, that just fitted the three of us. We requested a extra bed since the 'double bed wasnt big enough to fit two people. The bed was delivered without extra charge. The hotel is situated 10 seconds run from the Tottenham Court Road tube station, and you can walk to oxford street within 10 minutes. A perfect location! Breakfast was included which has just what you want; freshly fried eggs on request, toast cerial in many flavors, juice, fresh tee or coffee, milk. I am definately staying here the next time I go to London!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: cambert
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here. The rooms are small but they're comfortable and inexpensive. Staff are friendly and responsive, the breakfast is good, and the location is unbeatable. Just a few minutes' walk from Oxford Street, Soho, and the West End theatres. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Cheshire Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcelinoos
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week and found the staff very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but comfortable and internet is free in the lobby. It is centrally located and within easy walking distance from Piccadilly Circus, Soho, Oxford street. They are still trying to improve their services so we'll be back. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat primitive”
Reviews.Author: peterzan
Reviews.Content: Very good breakfast. Good bathroom. Phone didnt work in or out. Good big bed with, strangely, a loose, free-standing bedhead, the size of only two thirds of the width of the bed, meant for a smaller, single bed. Gives a very poor impression, decadent, lazy, lacking in style. I hope this minute room was meant for only a single occupant. No room to swing a cat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Service!”
Reviews.Author: Megamert
Reviews.Content: The value can't be beat! True, my room was tiny (although I found it cozy and comforting), but it was clean and well-quipped. The staff was friendly and attentive. And the location was perfect! Perhaps the best value-oriented hotel I've ever stayed at (and I've stayed at them all over the world)!

Reviews.Title: “once again do not be put off by one or two bad reviews !!”
Reviews.Author: dayoff2day
Reviews.Content: yes the rooms were small ish yes it had some cracked tiles in the bathroom and yes there was noise.but lets get this in context here the room was warm and cosy ,tea making,iron&board.hair dryer, great tv plenty of hot water.the noise was from being in sutch a great part of London just 2min to shaftesbury ave,old Compton st,Lester squire,trafalgar and piccadilly just a bit further the breakfast was freshly cooked and as my friend said not the usual greasy offering from jury's over the road and it would cost you Â£130 more.so if you want a budget hotel that is warm comfortable great friendly staff (everyone says hello and makes you feel welcome even the chamber maids as you pass )in the best part this is it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: TRACTORBOY61
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel due to it's location (10 minutes walk from the "JERSEY BOYS" - the show as excellent - even at the 2nd time of seeing it),The room was smallish but OK just for a one hight stay - I would not recommend it for a longer stay as it would prove claustrophobic. The issue we had was with the reception staff :- when we arrived at the hotel they told us (politely) that they could not trace our reservation so we provided them with documentary evidence, at which point they then found our reservation, and a key was duly issued. When we went out for the evening we left our key at reception, as instructed, and upon our return went to reception to ask for it back. . We waited for the lady on reception to finish an evidently persoanl call - after noticing us,she briefly paused her call so we gave her our room number, after a cursory look she said she couldn't find our key (remember there are only 30 rooms) and insinuated that we had not given the key in. We insisted that we had handed the key in, so she had another look and located the key and it was thrown accross the desk with out a word being spoken. My wife and I just laughed at her complete lack of customer service. So if you want a convenient, smallish and quiet room for one night only this hotel is OK, but if Basil Fawlty style customer service isn't your bag then there are probably better rooms to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel/good for the price”
Reviews.Author: racham08
Reviews.Content: Stayed 07/11/09. Rooms small so as an overnight stay ok but wouldnt recommend to stay for a week! However room clean, bed fine & shower good & powerful. Noise at night from street, but hey this is central london, 2 mins from dominion theatre & oxford street. Found staff pleasant & breakfast good.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER, EVER Stay at This Hotel Again!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: daphneskid
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decayed, the service deplorable, and the front desk manager was down right criminal when he knowingly double charged us for our stay! When we went into our extremely small (even compared to usual European standards) and dirty room, we discovered a burnt lamp shade over one of the bed, the toilet and sink leaked as well as the sink not draining! Needless to say we didn't want to stay in the room. The hotel's solution was to make us stay in the room that night with an "upgrade" to a "suite" for the rest of our stay for an additional fee for the "better" room! As well, the front desk manager kept badgering us to book his tourist packages, which we told him were not needed as I have actually lived in London and know the city. At the end of our stay, he lied to my husband again about the pricing for transporation to the airport and kept trying get us to book a taxi to Heathrow through him (which would have been 5x the actual cost to get to the airport). Never stay at this hotel, unless you'd like to stay in sub-par accommodations. Definitely NOT worth the money spent to stay here. There are far better hotels in London which will have functioning plumbing, clean rooms, and an honest staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not for claustrophobiacs”
Reviews.Author: alya_s
Reviews.Content: We were booked at this hotel because there was nothing else available in the area. The rooms were the tiniest I've seen in Europe. I've only seen a similar size hotel room in Tokyo. Don't expect any help getting your luggage in and out the room. The luggage storage room is like a pigeonhole. There is a takeaway next door and some rooms smell like curry. If you are used to 4+ level hotel service, don't ruin your trip to London by staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable & smelly bed”
Reviews.Author: dorsetgal
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on location and price. The single room I was allocated looked out onto the well of the building and the star feature was a sheet of wire netting covered in bird poo. Asked to move and was given a twin room. Very small & if there were two people in the room they would have been tripping over each other. On a positve note the room was made up each day in an identical way, the bathroom had ample soap & shower gel, and the TV was excellent (new large plasma that contrary to the website I did not have to pay extra to use). The staff were all very friendly. The bedding, like many cheaper hotels, left a lot to be desired. The blankets, pillows, and in particular the bed cover have the fug ("old man smell") of the last 1000 people that have stayed in the room. The window blind was broken and only had one position - down - so I needed to have the light on at all time. The hallway on the 1st floor is used as storage for vacumn cleaners and bags of bedding - as this is the fire escape it does represent a hazard if there were an emergency evacuation. If I had paid more than the Â£69 per night that I did I would have stamped my feet and screamed. I'm still itching from the thought of that smelly bedding.

Reviews.Title: “would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: Stevemarg01
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 1 night couldn't have taken two. The rooms where tiny and unbearably hot and as for the bed I have really slept on softer floors. The lifts smelt of what I can only descibe as sewerage which forced me to use the stairs where the smell was slightly less unbearable. Only stay here if the alternative is a cardboard box under the arches. I have stayed in a lot of hotels and I am prepared to make allowances and did I stayed for one night. However, I know my wife would have walked out.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: flakegirl
Reviews.Content: What on earth are people expecting? If you have paid more than the Â£70 that we paid (the Saturday before Xmas) then you need to shop around. We booked with Discount City Hotels (online). We found the staff to be very helpful from the minute we arrived. We found a leak in our bathroom and the staff immediately gave us a new room without any problems. The rooms are small, we think they might have been singles originally because of the single headboard fixed above our small double bed, however, why do you want to spend so much time sitting in a London hotel room? We like to make the most of our short stays and exlore the capital which seems to keep going 24 hours a day! And that's why we go there. Location is 5 mins walk from Oxford Street and the West End theatres etc. and the British museum is almost next door. If you are hungry, walk for 10 mins to China Town in Soho and eat as much as you like from Â£4.99 to Â£8.90. Breakfast in the hotel is served in a contemporary styled dining room (full English or continental and loads of food to help yourself to if you want). We have stayed in a variety of places and since our regular hotel is now closed this is definately a good alternative (so long as we get a good deal !!!!). So basically you have to decide what is really important and if you want to be pampered and fussed around then go book into the Savoy! This hotel was clean, friendly, cheap and easily accesible. That's what is important to us.

Reviews.Title: “Enter at your peril.....”
Reviews.Author: MitchamboyManty
Reviews.Content: me and the missus picked up the keys to room 307. Then it went pear shaped. We opened the door to find someone else already in there. We were moved to the top floor room 505 which made hotel rooms in Italy look like aircraft hangars. It was without doubt the smallest hotel room I've ever seen.The modest size bed was pushed up sideways on against the wall with each end of the bed touching the side walls. And it was so hot in the room even with no heat on. The carpet was filthy and there was paper peeling off the walls.Don't look under the bed. While she tried the shower I went to complain taking the emergency stairs as the lift was tiny. The first flight down to the 4th floor was in complete darkness and the carpet had come loose on some steps showing concrete beneath. I could not believe I was in a London hotel. My home town. I don't know what nationality the staff were, but they could have been more sympathetic. We tried a couple of other hotels but the Tour de France was in town so no joy. Then the hair dryer didn't work and when we checked the service tag it was 2 years out of compliance. 2 years! Breakfast was terrible. The mushrooms and the fried tomato were cold and the fried egg was solid. But that did make the tea seem hotter. There was one guy serving,taking orders and trying to clear up and the poor fella kept apologising in broken English. God knows what American tourists must think.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobia guaranteed”
Reviews.Author: aribari
Reviews.Content: My favourite hotels were fully booked at the time of my travel, so I chose this hotel because of its excellent location. Based on the price paid (~100 GBP/night) I would have expected much more. I got the smallest room I've ever seen. It was more like a matchbox. Strange that the bathroom was quite spacious. Try to avoid the 4th floor, as there is a molding in front of the window, which takes the whole view. Apart from its size, the room was very well equipped: TV, telephone, tea and coffee making facilities, hairdryer, iron, excellent (free) internet connection (own laptop, or TV & keyboard). Reception staff are friendly, but not too professional. I was very surprised that the whole price was requested in advance. Later I realized that the cause might have been the possibility to leave the hotel through an unattended back-door. Breakfast was OK, served by very attentive staff, in a fairly spacious area.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! Don't even think about it. Never book here. Ever!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sbpwilliams
Reviews.Content: We arrived @ the hotel early (10:00) for the last may bank holiday. We were off to a good start as we were able to check into our room. However we did book a twin room & ended up with a double. Oh well! Our room 503 was very small & very hot. The Bathroom was huge though! It was raining so the only ventilation was through the windows. The left hand side window was missing the lock. The TV sits directly in front of the open windows so it not only impedes the view but the windows could not be left open overnight to let fresh air as it was raining & it would have blown the TV with water. This meant 2 sleepless nights due to heat. The English breakfast served should not be fed to animals let alone paying guests. We were served coffee & were not given teaspoons. I got up & asked for a spoon on either day. The spoon arrived when the food did. The toast came out burnt, cold & we had to ask for butter. On our day of departure Monday 28th May, we had packed our belongings & were leaving the room for breakfast. We were met by the cleaner in the hall who asked if he could clean our room whilst we were at breakfast. We had no objections & left him to clean the room. We came back to the room after our breakfast to find our room door open with not only our room key in the door but the room keys for every other room also. The cleaner was nowhere to be seen. We collected our belongings & checked out of the hotel. It was only when we got home that I realised that I left our Digital Camera in the wardrobe. I phoned the hotel to report it immediately only to be informed that there was another guest in the room now. They stated that they do check the rooms thoroughly after checkout. They advised that they would go up to the room & look for the camera in the wardrobe. They called back & said that there was a Panasonic charger but not a cannon like ours. I am still having to call on a daily basis. No one is taking ownership of the problem. I keep having to explain the situation to every person I speak to. I don't know what else to do. I can't give up on it. The camera cost over 600 pounds. Please take my advice. The security is not up to scratch. Don't fall victim like we have. I read these trip advisor & saw the reviews on this hotel but never in a million years did I think that we could have this happen to us.

Reviews.Title: “this could be a very nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: HeleenLewin
Reviews.Content: very good location, nice, small hotel, reasonable prices. But....A very big but: the hotel is understaffed. When you are lucky this will not be a problem (and iff you are willing to settle for the small, not too clear rooms, curtains that cannot be opened, the smell of smoke) but hey, look at the prices..)but arriving in an overcrowded weekend as we did, it turned out to be a stressfull experience. When we came there April 22th only two people were trying to do the check-in and check-outs, answering the questions, answering the phone's etc. etc. They were friendly but looked stressed out already at 9.00 in the morning. We could leave our luggage for the rest of the day but before we went into town we were asked to pay in advance. I thought I misunderstood because we did not even see the rooms yet and refused, I mean they had our creditcard number! We went into town, but not after we ensured our booking (double rooms for single use) was okee. When we came in in the evening we were again asked to pay in advance before we had seen the rooms, we could not even take our luggage upstairs. I found this alarming and refused again. What a dissapointment it was to find out that one of the rooms was not cleaned yet (and could not be cleaned that night since the girl at the reception told us, almost crying that she was the only one there) and the other room was stuffed with three instead of one bed. My friend got another very small room, and I accepted a small discount because the clearly overworked girl was in tears. We both went to bed. At night it was as if people from the other rooms were in your room and I had to take a sleeping pill to get some sleep. The breakfast was fine although it took some time to get what we wanted because of the language problem. In the end we got and the continental and the English breakfast! Lest best (not really) when we left the hotel the manager(?) and the girl at the reception were in a fight and although it was clear we, the customers, were in the small lobby, and could overhear everything, it just went on and on with the girl crying and the manager telling her se had done 'it' all wrong. Before I decided to help the poor girl our cab came and we silently left the hotel. Never to return again. What a pitty it was I found out I left my cardigan in the room. I hope they will return it after this review, did not hear anything yet...

Reviews.Title: “bring earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: MissSunshine15
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for its location, which I would not fault. Very close to the tube. Room not ready when we arrived so our luggage was stored until we returned later. The room was very small with a nasty nylon carpet. It had a double and single bed, and a table and chair squashed at the end. TV and all the usual bit and pieces. The bath, basin and loo were clean, but the bathroom looked generally grubby. When you showered, it caused a flood to the bathroom and out to the bedroom carpet. We came back late to the hotel after a concert. The windows are only single glazzed and the general traffic/street noise was very loud. People shouting, sirens going off etc. The room was very hot but we couldnt open a window because of the noise. Then at about 4.00 am just when we were almost asleep, a drunk was banging on the doors and shouting in the corridor. THis continued for quite a while until eventually someone took him away. Breakfast in the basement was OK but only one poor guy trying to do it all on his own. A bit chaotic but the food was not great but edible! even if the toast is best avoided (cheap white bread, very chewy, not crsip!)

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: marcuschap72
Reviews.Content: I have rated this hotel 4 because of the value for money aspect not because it's a great hotel, though to be fair it's not that bad either. I paid just Â£60 for a twin room including breakfast but wouldn't be happy paying full rate to stay at Country Inn. The location can't be beat for my needs (a night out), it's a 2 minute stroll from Tottenham Court Rd Tube. Obviously being so central it is noisy outside at all hours and the rooms are only single glazed. No problem for me as a few glasses of vino and i'll sleep through anything! The room was spotlessly clean and i was pleasantly surprised at the standard after reading some previous reviews. The only negative of the room was the ridiculously small bathroom - seriously it's the smallest i've ever seen! It wasn't a major problem though as i didn't plan on spending too much time in there. Only one thing about the hotel was terrible and that's breakfast. No buffet table at all and the one 'waitress' is v busy so if you don't want to wait forever and a day even to get a glass of juice you have to catch her while she's at the counter and order. If you want another glass of juice, etc again catch her while you can! There's a choice of continental or cooked but you can't have both so i had the vegetarian breakfast, it arrived and comprised of 2 eggs, 1 tomato and 3 mushrooms - hardly substantial. For my needs at that price the hotel overall was ok, i would stay again at Â£60 per night but wouldn't bother getting out of bed for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “3* Hotel?? Not by a long shot! The Good, The bad and The Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: blankman
Reviews.Content: Where to begin .... It went downhill from the onset â€“ we were looking for a hotel for NYE and saw this place. I checked the reviews on here, where many of the recent reviews were negative, which did trigger some alarm bells. However, given we had limited options left, we chose to book and hope for the best â€¦err big mistake! The hotel says 3 * on the door â€“ no way â€“ more like a 2* bed and breakfast! But the reason for this isnâ€™t because the hotel is unclean and functional, but purely down to the lack of professionalism and management policy. We came away feeling the management seemed to be unable to deal with any (simple) problems that arose. THE GOOD - here are the positive points: -Room & Bathroom were clean and functional, and albeit small (even though we had one of the bigger rooms!) -Sheets were clean thankfully!! â€“ (See a previous review) -Breakfast was adequate, although cold! But thatâ€™s about it on the positive frontâ€“hereâ€™s THE BAD: -Room was tiny â€“ Bed was even smaller and very uncomfortable. I agree that the bed is not suitable for anyone over 5â€� 8!! -There was no heating control in each room â€“ the room got so hot through the night that I woke up sweating and had to open a window! -The TV channels didnâ€™t work, and hadnâ€™t worked for at least 24 hours â€“ the claim was that TV decoders/antennas werenâ€™t working! The hotel then had the cheek on charging guest for watching a pay movie instead (which curiously was not affected by the antenna problem?!!) even though they were not able to fix the TV until at least 2 days later!! What reflected poor customer service is that the management thought it was ok to charge customers and opposed to giving it complimentary to make up for the broken TV antennas and claimed that it an external source! What a joke!! THE UNBELIEVAEBLE: But thatâ€™s not the worst of it â€“ they said the bar was undergoing refurbishment, which is fine â€“ so we went and bought some wine to drink in the room, to entertain ourselves, whilst the TV wasnâ€™t working. So we bought some wine, and requested some ice, an ice bucket and a corkscrew â€“ to which we were told the following: (i) The corkscrew â€“ we donâ€™t have one!! â€“ What!! Youâ€™re a 3* hotel, with a bar, and you donâ€™t have a corkscrew â€“ err no we have one, but we cant find it currently!! (ii) Ice â€“ Oh our ice machine is broken they claimedâ€¦lolâ€¦they probably decided not to fix it, as with no corkscrew, why would people need ice anyway?? (ii)The ice bucket â€“ err, no reason was ever given, and we just gave up!! Security wasnâ€™t great either, we came back to the hotel in the middle of the night, the front door was open and no-one seemed to be in receptionâ€¦.hmmmâ€¦!! Seriously, im not one to make unfair critical comments, but the management and select (but not all) members of the staff were a joke â€“ no professionalism, no ability to acknowledge or deal with problems and no discount offered to compensate for the complete lack of facilities/services expected from a 3* hotel!! This hotel used to be much better, but the new owners really donâ€™t know much about the hotel business or leisure, tourism or hospitality sector. On the plus side, the room was clean, albeit it small, and the location is two mins from Tottenham court road station and the East end of Oxford Street. If you want a small clean place to stay, you wont be spending much time in the hotel, other than sleeping (on a rather uncomfortable bed), then this is a good place. But if you expect any kind of service, including a corkscrew, ice or a working TV, then this really isnâ€™t the place for you. Iâ€™m trying to be as objective as I can, but even after a 10 minute heated discussion with the manager, I was shocked as to the audacity of the hotel management! My hint, if staying here, opt for a corner room, as they are apparently bigger than a shoe box!

Reviews.Title: “Don't look uner the covers!”
Reviews.Author: charlieclown
Reviews.Content: the photos of this hotel suggest a small but discreet hotel with traditional furnishings and fittings - and that is not a false impression. But you would be wrong to assume that this means it is a hotel with dining areas of old mahogany, a spacious lobby with solid, time-served antiques and a lounge and bar with olde-worlde comforts - it has none of those. The only public space is the lobby and you can walk across it in about 5 paces. The room I stayed in appeared small when I opened the door but it turned out to be a little bigger once I got inside. The traditional furnishings were used in the room as well - which looked dark but comfortable. Unfortunately the olde-worlde concept also seemed to extend to the laundry - the bedding looked as if it had never been near a washing machine - grubby and stained (yeucch!). I only stayed for one night but I don't think I could have faced going back to sleep in a hotel which, on the face of its looks good, but which in reality is very grubby and dissappointing. One other thing - every time I went into the lobby it seemed to be in use as a meeting room for off-duty taxi drivers. Not great.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't go there”
Reviews.Author: benwa
Reviews.Content: By far the worst hotel during my last trip in UK. I have to agree with the reviewer from Boston. My room was on the first floor and didnâ€™t feel safe at all. Fortunately, I was there for only one night. The bed was such in a bad condition that I woke up in the morning with terrible back pain. My back was still sore after 3 days. A concrete slab would have been more comfortable. I told the manager to throw this bed in the garbage the next morning but Iâ€™m sure it is still there. The cigarette smell was terrible even if I had booked a non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: monkeynonk
Reviews.Content: A great alternative to the big chain hotels nearby. Location is great, just off tottenham court road, a five minute walk to all of the new restaurants just to the west of tottenham ct rd. The room was small, but comfortable and clean with nice bathroom, LCD TV, small working area with broadband. No aircon however. Lacks a bar, but plenty of bars and pubs nearby that are open into the very early hours. Reception was manned 24 hours so no problems when we crawled back in at 2am! Better than your average London 3*, but on a much smaller scale.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Tiny, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: RichmondVATraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights when we were passing through London. Pros: Friendly staff, good breakfast, nice bathrooms. Good neighborhood and close to tube station. Cons: Both rooms were so small that we had to move out of each other's way constantly. No AC. Would we stay here again? Probably not, because of the lack of space.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, and great location”
Reviews.Author: scottish-lass2
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel for a long weekend in London for my birthday. Location is brilliant, as only 5min walk to tube which is easy to find and you are just off oxford street so is very central. Found hotel to be friendly, though there english could be abit better, but got buy. Our room was very small, and the bed no good for anyone over 5ft 6in but very clean which we found was main thing, plus for all time you really spend in them we were not to bothered. The bathroom is very big and has good shower. Breakfast room is nice & clean and breakfast was good to. We were abit disappointed that the hotel doesn't have its own bar or do evening meals, as would have been nice just to relax in there one night instead of having go up the street to find places. I do advise that if you book a taxi threw the hotel ensure that you do so early as we had asked them to book one for us on our 2nd nights stay to take us to a restaurant and it was over half hour in arriving meaning we had to call the restaurant and explain we were gonna be there just taxi late, luckily they wee ok about it. We did enjoy our stay at the hotel and would stay there again i think if we ever return to london, because it is in such an excellant spot .

HotelInfo.Name: Cheshire Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 110 Great Russell Street, London WC1B 3NA, England (Formerly Country Inn & Suites)
